intro: Triumfetta dehiscens, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open when mature, dispersing its seeds. Triumfetta dehiscens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
